349.article_body: A portion of a five-storey residential building in Thane's Daighar area has collapsed, officials said on Saturday. No one was hurt in the incident which occurred on Friday night. Residents and the shops on the ground floor have been evacuated and the building has been marked for being pulled down, chief of the Regional Disaster Management Cell Avinash Sawant said.

350.title: T20 cricket can be very fickle in its nature: Williamson
350.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson has said that "T20 cricket can be very fickle in its nature". "We are just trying to improve and bring guys into the side and give them clear roles...Just trying to keep things nice and simple," Williamson said. New Zealand took an unassailable lead of 2-0 in the series against the West Indies on Friday.

351.title: 6 arrested from Delhi's outer district for fuel theft from tankers
351.article_body: Six men were arrested from Delhi's outer district area on Friday after they were allegedly caught siphoning fuel from tankers. Police said they received information that one Amarjeet would siphon fuel from tankers at Swarn Park and sell the stolen fuel. Owner of one of the tankers from which fuel was allegedly being siphoned gave a complaint to the police.

352.title: Brazil reports record deforestation in Amazon from Jan-July in 2022
352.article_body: Deforestation in Brazil's Amazon rainforest reached a record high for the first seven months of the year, according to preliminary government data. Government satellite data showed 5,474 square kilometres were cleared in the region from January to July, up 7.3% from the same period of last year. Notably, 1,487 square kilometres were cleared in July alone.

353.title: 21,000 fish killed due to ‘catastrophic failure’ at California university
353.article_body: A "catastrophic failure" has resulted in the loss of about 21,000 fish at a university research facility in California. "The loss appears to be due to chlorine exposure, to which fish are...sensitive," a statement read. The University of California, Davis, said it has initiated an independent external review to determine where its systems failed and potential risks at similar facilities.

354.title: Women need to sleep with someone for K'taka govt job, says Cong MLA; BJP responds
354.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Priyank Kharge on Friday stated that "men have to bribe while young women have to sleep with someone to get a government job" in BJP-ruled Karnataka. He demanded an investigation into recruitment scams. BJP leader and Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "Whatever he said was happening during Congress rule- at the Centre and in state."

355.title: 3 men pose as policemen to rob gold worth ₹22 lakh in Mumbai, arrested
355.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested three men for allegedly robbing gold worth ₹22 lakh from a man who had recently returned from Dubai. According to the police, the men posed as police officials and stopped the victim's auto-rickshaw. On the pretext of checking the vehicle, they robbed the gold and escaped on a bike. Another accused is currently absconding, police added.

356.title: Protests were aimed at overthrowing govt: Sierra Leone's Prez
356.article_body: Sierra Leone's President Julius Maada Bio on Friday said that this week's anti-government protests were an attempt to overthrow the government. The protests led to the deaths of six police officers and at least 21 civilians. However, several residents have said that the protests were driven by frustration with the worsening economic situation, according to Reuters.

357.title: I feel those are shortcuts: 'Taare...' actor Darsheel on asking Aamir for work
357.article_body: Darsheel Safary, who started his acting career with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Taare Zameen Par', has said he could've approached Aamir for another film, but didn't feel like taking the "shortcut". "I feel those are like shortcuts," Darsheel said, adding, "Not that I want to take a long cut but a learning cut. I think I don't need to force."

358.title: US man builds own broadband to avoid high net access fee, gets ₹20 cr from govt
358.article_body: A man in US' Michigan who built his own broadband to avoid a $50,000 (around ₹40 lakh) fee to extend web access to his home, has now won a $2.6 million (₹20 crore) government bid. Network engineer Jared Mauch set up his own Internet Service Provider and got 70 customers. He's now been funded to expand to 600 additional homes.

359.title: Aamir joins Har Ghar Tiranga campaign, displays Tricolour at his house
359.article_body: Aamir Khan displayed the Tricolour at his Mumbai residence on Friday as part of 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The campaign was introduced by PM Narendra Modi to mark 75 years of India's independence. Aamir, while reacting to 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' trend on Twitter, had said, "I feel sad some...people who're saying this...believe...I'm someone who doesn't like India...but it's untrue."

360.title: Coffee Day Enterprises narrows net loss to ₹18 crore in Q1
360.article_body: Coffee Day Enterprises reported a narrowing of its consolidated net loss to ₹18 crore for the quarter ended June 30 as against a net loss of ₹117.28 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its revenue from operations jumped to ₹210.49 crore as against ₹81.52 crore in the year-ago period. Its expenses also saw a 17.96% rise to ₹237.75 crore.

361.title: Direct your complaints to Kremlin: Ukraine to Russians against travel ban
361.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said, "Russians who're upset with the prospect of being banned from tourist travel to Europe can direct their complaints to the Kremlin and over 70% of their compatriots who support the war." Kuleba's comments came after Ukrainian President Zelenskyy called on European Union states to ban visas for rich Russian nationals.

362.title: NMDC sets target to produce 46 million tonnes of iron ore in FY23
362.article_body: Government-owned miner NMDC Limited has set a goal to achieve 46 million tonnes of iron ore production in the current financial year, Chairman and Managing Director Sumit Deb said. This would be 10% higher than that of last year, he added. NMDC achieved the production of 42.19 MT and sales of 40.56 MT in FY22 with a ₹25,882 crore turnover.

363.title: RSS changes social media profile pics to Tricolour ahead of Independence Day
363.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) changed the display pictures of its social media accounts to the Tricolour from its traditional saffron flag. RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat also changed his social media profile pictures to the national flag. This comes after several political leaders criticised RSS for not changing its profile pictures amid the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign.

364.title: 200 children take part in NDRF-led National Flag rally in Hyderabad
364.article_body: Around 200 children participated in the National Flag rally led by the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) in Hyderabad's Hamidullah Nagar. "As a part of the Har Ghar Tiranga programme...we gave...National Flags to the kids and also made them aware of its significance," Shaikpet Assistant Commandant Damodhar Singh said. The event was conducted as part of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

365.title: Labourer electrocuted to death while setting up Tricolour in Chhattisgarh
365.article_body: A 36-year-old contract labourer working with the local civic body was electrocuted to death in Chhattisgarh's Korea district on Saturday. The incident took place when the deceased, identified as Suman Tigga, was erecting the national flag on a mast along with another labourer, a police official said. "His colleague Ramkripal Singh suffered injuries and is hospitalised," the official added.

366.title: BMC to spend ₹7 cr to fix pothole-ridden roads in Mumbai
366.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to spend ₹7 crore to fix pothole-ridden roads in the city. The BMC will issue the work order before Ganesh Utsav and the work will begin soon after, Additional Municipal Commissioner P Velrasu said. "We have floated tender for three new techniques for filling the potholes in Mumbai," Velrasu added.

367.title: Meghalaya CM Sangma a puppet appointed by Delhi: TMC leader
367.article_body: TMC leader Mukul Sangma on Friday said the NPP-led Meghalaya Democratic Alliance (MDA) government has been formed by PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah. "CM Conrad Sangma is merely a puppet appointed by Delhi," Mukul further said. His reaction came a day after NPP announced that it will contest the Meghalaya Assembly elections alone next year.

368.title: Centre misusing central probe agencies: Tejashwi Yadav
368.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav alleged that the Centre is misusing the central probe agencies for its political gains. He also added that Mahagathbandhan will not be "scared" by such tactics. "CBI, ED, IT Department are being ruined one by one. Their condition is worse than a police station...[Bihar has] a pro-people government [and]...will work with strength," said Yadav.

369.title: SC notice to Gujarat government on Asaram’s bail plea
369.article_body: The Supreme Court has issued notice to the Gujarat government on a bail plea filed by self-styled godman Asaram Bapu. Asaram filed an appeal in the apex court against Gujarat High Court's December 10, 2021 order rejecting his bail plea in the rape case. A bench posted the case for hearing on September 7.

370.title: India resumes mango exports to US after 2 years due to pandemic
370.article_body: India resumed mango exports to the US, with over 1,000 tonne of Alphonso, Kesar and other varieties having been shipped recently. The exports were halted for two years because inspectors from the US Department of Agriculture couldn't visit India to inspect the irradiation facilities due to the travel restrictions induced by the COVID-19 pandemic.

371.title: Nothing unconventional: Roshan on relationship with Shefali in Darlings
371.article_body: Discussing his relationship with actress Shefali Shah in 'Darlings', where she's seen portraying Alia Bhatt's mother, actor Roshan Mathew said, "There is nothing unconventional...about this." "(His initial hesitation) is because of society," added Roshan. Discussing her onscreen kiss with Roshan, Shefali had said it took her by "surprise". "She does it [as] she wants to shut him up," she added.

372.title: Russia blocking access to medicines: Ukraine Health Minister
372.article_body: Ukraine's Health Minister Viktor Liashko said Russian authorities have repeatedly blocked efforts to provide state-subsidised drugs to people in areas that its forces have occupied, since invading the country in February. "We consider these actions 'to be crimes against humanity' and war crimes that will be documented and will be recognised," Liashko added, while talking to The Associated Press.

373.title: KKR franchise keen to acquire a team in women's IPL: Report
373.article_body: The Knight Riders Group, the owner of the IPL franchise KKR, is reportedly keen to own a team in the upcoming women's IPL tournament. According to a Sportskeeda report, the franchise is likely to be Kolkata-based. A source told Sportskeeda that the Knight Riders Group is keen on working with the Cricket Association of Bengal to "groom and pick players".

374.title: Top Cong leaders to meet on Aug 16 ahead of 'mega' protest on price rise
374.article_body: Ahead of "mega" protest rally against price rise and unemployment, Congress has called a meeting of all its general secretaries and state incharges on August 16 to finalise the strategy for 'Mehngai Chaupals'. The party has planned to stage a series of protests in retail markets and other locations in all Assembly constituencies from August 17 to August 23.

375.title: China's actions fundamentally at odds with goal of peace: US
375.article_body: The White House on Friday said that China's actions are fundamentally at odds with the goal of peace and stability. The comment was made in response to recent Chinese actions due to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. "They are part of an intensified pressure campaign against Taiwan, which has not ended," it added.

376.title: RBI directs loan recovery agents to not harass borrowers over dues
376.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday directed banks and regulated entities to ensure that their recovery agents do not resort to harassment or intimidation of borrowers over dues. The RBI observed that the recovery agents are not following the extant instructions. It also set the timing for the call for recovery between 8 am and 7 pm.

377.title: Rosneft-backed Nayara Energy reports ₹3,564 crore profit in Q1
377.article_body: Nayara Energy, backed by Russian oil company Rosneft, reported a net profit of ₹3,563.7 crore in the April-June quarter as against a loss of ₹139.1 crore in the corresponding period last year. Its profit in the January-March quarter was ₹409.5 crore. Nayara Energy operates over 6,500 petrol pumps in the country and a refinery at Vadinar in Gujarat.

378.title: J&K govt sacks Hizbul chief's son, JKLF chief Bitta Karate's wife over terror links
378.article_body: J&K administration on Saturday sacked four government employees for alleged links with terror groups. Jammu Kashmir Liberation Front's (JKLF) terror-accused chief Bitta Karate's wife Assabha Arzoomand Khan and Hizbul Mujahideen chief Syed Salahuddin's son Syed Abdul Mueed are reportedly among them. Khan was a Jammu and Kashmir Administrative Service officer. Mueed worked as an IT manager.

379.title: Government cannot deny benefits to non-religious people: Kerala HC
379.article_body: Kerala High Court said that citizens from economically weaker sections cannot be denied benefits because they do not identify with a religion. "The government has to formulate a policy for issuing certificates to persons like petitioners who've declared themselves to be non-religious," it added. "A government that claims to be progressive cannot deny benefits to such citizens," HC stated.

380.title: SUV hits parked truck as driver tries to save cow in Maha; 4 dead
380.article_body: Four people were killed and one other person was injured after an SUV rammed into a parked truck in Maharashtra's Chandrapur, police said on Saturday. The accident occurred after the SUV's driver lost control over the vehicle while trying to save a cow sitting on the road, an assistant inspector said. The injured person was taken to a hospital.

381.title: China to send fighter jets & bombers to Thailand for military drills
381.article_body: China is sending fighter jets and bombers to Thailand for a joint exercise with the Thai military on Sunday. The Chinese Defence Ministry said that the training will include air support, strikes on ground targets and small- and large-scale troop deployment. The training comes as the US holds military drills in Indonesia with Indonesia, Australia, Japan and Singapore.

382.title: Noida woman grabs e-rickshaw driver's collar, slaps him 17 times for hitting her car
382.article_body: A video showing a woman slapping an e-rickshaw driver at least 17 times for allegedly hitting her car in Noida has surfaced online. The woman can be seen grabbing the man by his collar and taking him to the car. The woman can also be seen asking the man for his e-rickshaw's keys and forcefully checking his pockets.

383.title: Earlier Indian flag was burnt, today it can be hoisted across J&K: Thakur
383.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has said that in the past, the Indian flag was burnt in Jammu and Kashmir but now it can be hoisted anywhere. "After the abrogation of Article 370 and Article 35A under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi, now one can hoist the national flag in any corner of J&K," Thakur said.

384.title: Revenue department official arrested for taking ₹25,000 bribe in Jammu
384.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) arrested a revenue department official in Jammu for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹25,000. The accused had reportedly demanded a bribe of ₹50,000 from the complainant for issuing documents of land owned by him. CBI then laid a trap and arrested the accused. Cash worth ₹2 lakh was also recovered during searches, CBI said.

385.title: The schedule is broken: Styris on Boult giving up NZ central contract
385.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand's Trent Boult, the current world number one ODI bowler, giving up his central contract, ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris said, "It's...a bigger message that the schedule is broken." "Cricket can't afford to lose the likes of Ben Stokes and Boult...away from the international game," added Styris. "Nobody...thought...Boult is going to finish up...this soon," he stated.

386.title: PCMC says it's filled 1,800 potholes at the cost of ₹1 crore
386.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has said that it's filled 1,800 potholes or 88% of potholes in its jurisdiction at the cost of ₹1 crore. It'd taken time to fill potholes due to continuous rains, PCMC City Engineer (Civil) Makarand Nikam said. "We need...long dry spell so that pothole filling work can be carried out to last long," Nikam added.

387.title: 14-15 of my films had not worked a few yrs ago, so I thought of moving to Canada: Akshay
387.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about holding a Canadian passport, said he "is an Indian, from India, and will always remain so". "A few years ago, my films weren't working. Almost 14-15 films hadn't worked...I thought I should probably move elsewhere and work there," he added. Akshay further said after he began experiencing professional success again, he decided he should stay back.

388.title: Oppn ready with 'waiting list' of PM candidates without vacancy: Naqvi
388.article_body: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said the Opposition has already prepared a "waiting list of two dozen prime ministerial candidates" even when there is no vacancy for the post. He further added that "those suffering from political disease of Modi phobia will vanish soon". The former Union Minister was addressing a programme in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur district.

389.title: Sameer Wankhede gets clean chit in certificate case; panel says 'not Muslim by birth'
389.article_body: A Maharashtra caste scrutiny committee gave a clean chit to former NCB Zonal Director Sameer Wankhede in caste certificate case stating he wasn't a Muslim by birth. "It's not proven Wankhede and his father converted to Islam...they belonged to Mahar-37 Scheduled Caste," the order reads. Wankhede used a fake certificate to get government jobs, former minister Nawab Malik had claimed.

390.title: Astronaut sends I-Day greetings to India from Space Station, govt shares video
390.article_body: Ahead of India's Independence Day on August 15, astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti sent greetings from the International Space Station (ISS). In a video shared by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), the astronaut said, "It's a pleasure to congratulate India on 75 years of Independence." She also mentioned international agencies' cooperation with ISRO on the NISAR Earth Science Mission.

391.title: 5 die in Bihar's Saran, suspected to have consumed hooch
391.article_body: At least five people have died in Bihar's Saran district allegedly after consuming spurious liquor. "It is being said that these people died after consuming alcohol, however, it is not yet confirmed if they actually drank it," the Sub-Divisional Magistrate said. Around 10-12 people were arrested on Friday night after police personnel raided the Marhaura area in Saran.

392.title: Bombay HC orders ₹2 lakh as damages for wrongly keeping Nigerian man in jail
392.article_body: The Bombay High Court directed the Maharashtra government to pay ₹2 lakh to a Nigerian man jailed since October 2020 on the basis of an erroneous forensic report. The court has ordered to recover the amount from the errant officer of a forensic science laboratory, which has admitted its official's mistake. The judgement was given by Justice Bharati Dangre.

393.title: 1 killed, dozens injured as music festival stage collapses in Spain
393.article_body:
At least one person was killed and dozens others were injured after high winds caused part of a stage to collapse at a music festival in Spain on Saturday, regional emergency services said. Another infrastructure was also reportedly damaged when gusts battered the Medusa Festival. 
Of those wounded, three people have suffered serious trauma injuries, the emergency services added.

394.title: Don't know how he's feeling, I don't sleep with Haaland, jokes Guardiola
394.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola jokingly said he doesn't know how striker Erling Haaland is feeling after playing two games for the club, adding he doesn't "sleep" with him. "I am not at home with Haaland so I don't know how he handles it," added Guardiola. "People said he was a failure and...everyone laughed at him," Guardiola had earlier stated.

395.title: Telegram gets approval for app update after CEO blames Apple for delay
395.article_body: Telegram has released its new iOS update after getting approval from Apple. Earlier this week, Telegram CEO Pavel Durov had complained about the update being "stuck in Apple's review for two weeks". In a new post, Durov said the approval was granted after Telegram accepted Apple's demand to remove "Telemoji", vector-animated versions of the standard emoji, from the update.

396.title: 7 MP BJYM office-bearers removed from posts over ruckus at temple
396.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) has removed seven officer-bearers from their posts for allegedly creating ruckus at the Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple in Ujjain earlier this week. The incident occurred during the organisation's National President and BJP MP Tejasvi Surya's visit. State BJYM President Vaibhav Pawar issued a list of 18 workers and leaders involved in the incident.

397.title: Canara Bank cheated of ₹2.71 cr by fake companies in Hyderabad
397.article_body: Two fake companies allegedly cheated Hyderabad's Balanagar branch of Canara Bank of ₹2.71 crore by taking loans and not repaying them. A company AFS Constructions reportedly took a loan of ₹1.3 crore from the bank and officials later found that this was a fictional company. Similarly, ₹1.41 crore was given to Tirumala Enterprises Civil Engineering company based on fake documents.

398.title: 22-year-old woman in Delhi tests positive for monkeypox, 5th case in national capital
398.article_body: Delhi has reported its fifth confirmed monkeypox case in a 22-year-old woman. "The patient was admitted to Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan Hospital (LNJP) and her sample tested positive for monkeypox on Friday," MD LNJP Hospital Dr Suresh Kumar said. "At present, four patients are admitted, one discharged. Total five cases have been so far reported here," Kumar added.

399.title: What has Aamir done to deserve this: Mona on boycott 'Laal Singh...' trend
399.article_body: Actress Mona Singh, reacting to the calls to boycott Aamir Khan-starrer film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "I was very sad." "What has Aamir done to deserve this? He's a guy who has...entertained us for...last 30 years," Mona said, adding, "But I was very confident that...boycotters would come around once they started seeing that the film is resonating with every Indian."

400.title: Authorities take away pit bull that attacked woman in Gurugram
400.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram on Friday took custody of the pet pit bull that attacked and severely injured a woman on Thursday in the Civil Lines area. The dog will remain under a veterinary doctor's observation, an official said. On the basis of the doctor's report, the dog will either be returned to its owner or sent for training.

401.title: 2 B'luru hospitals directed to reserve beds for high-risk COVID patients
401.article_body: Amid a surge in COVID-19 infections, the Karnataka health department has directed two COVID-19 care hospitals in Bengaluru to reserve beds for high-risk patients. The directive has been issued for CV Raman General Hospital and Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College Hospital. Notably, Bengaluru has reported over 1,000 COVID-19 cases on at least five days since July 27.
